label: Behavior 56513089
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 53.8422 + 0.0015 × t + 0.0002 × t², lon(t) ≈ 8.9071 + 0.0043 × t - 0.0001 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed, with SOG varying only slightly between 6.3 and 9.1 knots, indicating steady propulsion)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG decreases smoothly from ~87° to ~9° over time, showing a continuous, controlled turn to the right, typical of navigation along a curved channel)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains closely aligned with COG throughout, with minimal deviation, suggesting no erratic yawing or loss of control)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 53.8422 + 0.0015 × t + 0.0002 × t², lon(t) ≈ 8.9071 + 0.0043 × t - 0.0001 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
